title: Sir Elton John supports Prince Harry's attack on the British press
text:
Sir Elton John is supporting Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle,38, following their unprecedented attack on the British press.

Earlier this month, Harry launched an extraordinary attack on the British media accusing the press of 'bullying' and 'relentless propaganda' and said his 'deepest fear' was his 'wife falling victim to the same powerful forces' that his mother faced.

Appearing on Lorraine today, royal editor Russell Myers claimed that the 72-year-old musician has advised the couple on the matter, and insisted that they should 'follow their hearts' if they feel 'strongly' about the issue.

The attack on the press came directly after Harry, Meghan and baby Archie enjoyed glowing media coverage on their very successful ten-day royal tour in Africa and appearing on Lorraine today, Russell opened up about a forthcoming ITV documentary following the couple as they travelled through the continent.

Prince Harry,35, launched an unprecedented attack on the British press earlier this month where he accused them of 'bullying' and 'relentless propaganda' against his wife Meghan Markle, 38

Sir Elton John, 71, has shown his support for the royal couple with a royal expert claiming he has insisted that the couple should 'follow their hearts' if they feel 'strongly' about the matter

Appearing on today's Lorraine show, royal editor Russell Myers said that Elton John has been advising Prince Harry and Meghan Markle in their fight against the British press

He said: 'It'll be fascinating to see the dynamic between the two and of course the relationship with the press and the pressure they feel they're under.

'Harry and Meghan's decision to start suing British newspapers, which I think is a real watershed moment in terms of the relationship between the royals and the press.'

Host Lorraine interjected : 'Well they've got Elton John on their side.'

The expert responded: ‘He's been giving advice, saying "if you feel very strongly about these things then you have to follow your heart"’.

Elton has a close connection to the Royal family, having having serenaded guests at the wedding of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex in May 2018 and is pictured here attending the wedding of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge at Westminster Abbey in 2011

The musician is a long-time friend of the royal couple, having serenaded guests at their wedding in May 2018 and in August this year the royals took a trip to Nice, France to stay with Elton in his £15million mansion.

He has a close connection to the Royal family and also attended the wedding of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge at Westminster Abbey in 2011.

In his statement against the press, Harry said: 'Unfortunately, my wife has become one of the latest victims of a British tabloid press that wages campaigns against individuals with no thought to the consequences – a ruthless campaign that has escalated over the past year, throughout her pregnancy and while raising our newborn son.

'There is a human cost to this relentless propaganda, specifically when it is knowingly false and malicious, and though we have continued to put on a brave face – as so many of you can relate to – I cannot begin to describe how painful it has been.

Harry added: 'My deepest fear is history repeating itself. I've seen what happens when someone I love is commoditised to the point that they are no longer treated or seen as a real person.'

Royal sources previously claimed Harry was warned not to publish the statement while he and Meghan were still on their publicly-funded tour of Africa.

They also allege he refused to tell his father Charles and brother William, who only found out when the message was published, The Times reports.

Harry's comments came as the royal couple announced Meghan had decided to take legal action against the Mail on Sunday after publication of a letter to her estranged father Thomas Markle

Harry's comments came as the royal couple announced Meghan had decided to take legal action against the Mail on Sunday after publication of a letter to her estranged father Thomas Markle.

The letter was revealed by Mr Markle in an interview in which he revealed how hurt he was by comments made by the Duchess's friends in an article for People magazine.

Law firm Schillings, representing the Duchess, said she had filed a High Court claim against the paper and its parent company Associated Newspapers over the alleged misuse of private information, infringement of copyright and breach of the Data Protection Act 2018.

A spokesman for the Mail on Sunday said: 'The Mail on Sunday stands by the story it published and will be defending this case vigorously. Specifically, we categorically deny that the Duchess's letter was edited in any way that changed its meaning.'
description: Appearing on Lorraine today, royal editor Russell Myers claimed that musician Elton John, 72, has been advising the couple, amid their unprecedented attack against the British press.
